Ultima Responsive HTML5 Landing Page V2.3.1

An Ultimate Landing Page for Presenting Your Products and Services

Introduction

Ultima is highly customizable and extendible HTML5 landing page. Whether you need to present your product, service, Web App or Mobile App, Ultima has you cover.

This feature-rich template build with Bootstrap 3 and has almost all its important components restyled. In addition to this we added some new components and transitions. As the result you have everything you need to build professional looking landing page that will surely impress your visitors.

Ultima comes with separate Coming Soon page. While your landing page is under construction show your visitors beautiful coming soon page with the coundown and subscription form. So they always stay connected.

Folders and Files

File Path Description
Main Root folder
Main/PSD PSD Folder includes all .psd files, which are:
Landing Page.psd - Layered psd file of Landing page;
Components & Styles.psd - Layered psd file of Components & Styles page;
Coming Soon.psd - Layered psd file of Coming Soon page.
Update v2.0.psd - Layered psd file with new elements and added navigation.
Main/Ultima This folder includes all HTML, CSS, Javascript, Fonts and Image files of the template.
Main/Ultima/index.html This is Demo (options) Page.
Main/Ultima/landing1.html This is Landing Page Template with Side Scroller.
Main/Ultima/landing2.html This is Landing Page Template with Pinned to Top Navigation.
Main/Ultima/cs-page.html This is Components & Styles Page Template.
Main/Ultima/coming-soon.html This is Coming Soon Page Template.
Main/Ultima/css This folder includes all .css files. To change the appearance of the template you need to modify file: theme-styles.css.
Main/Ultima/css/colors This folder holds all .css files with different color schemes. Each file has a color hex number in it's name.
Main/Ultima/js This folder includes all .js files. To edit Javascript functionality of the template you need to modify files: landing.js for Landing page, coming-soon.js for Coming Soon page and components-styles.js for Components & Styles page respectively. It also includes 2 subfolders: libs and plugins
Main/Ultima/js/libs This folder includes all JavaScript Libraries files like jQuery.
Main/Ultima/js/plugins This folder includes all jQuery Plugins used in this template.
Main/Ultima/img This folder includes all graphic assets of the template. When you need to change images, slides, backgrounds, etc..this is the place to go.
Main/Ultima/fonts This folder includes IcoMoon and Font Awsome generated Fonts. They are iconic fonts, that gives you customizable vector icons (more than 800 icons). For more information on how it works, please visit: IcoMoon Official Website and Font Awsome Official Website
Main/Ultima/cheatsheets This folder holds cheatsheet .pdf files of Iconic fonts for you to use as a guide.

Customizing Template (Editing HTML Files)

HTML Structure (Landing Page)

HTML Code devided into sections that are represented by <section> tag. Each section is a block of content. Thus, if you want to change content of Features block you do it in section with id="features". Document is properly commented so you won't get lost. Please note the id tags of each section correlate with anchors in the side menu to allow scrolling navigation.


                <!--Preloader-->
                <div id="preloader">
                  <!--Preloader Code Goes Here-->
                </div>
                
                <!--Navigation-->
                <nav class="side-navi">
                  <!--Side Navigation Code Goes Here-->
                </nav>
                 
                <!--Header (Hero Unit with Slider)-->
                <header class="hero">
                  <!--Header/Top Menu/Hero Slider Content Goes Here-->
                </header>
                 
                <!--Features-->
                <section class="page-block" id="features">
                  <!--Content Goes Here-->
                </section>
                 
                <!--Gallery-->
                <section class="page-block" id="gallery">
                  <!--Content Goes Here-->
                </section>
                 
                <!--Pricing Plans-->
                <section class="page-block" id="pricing">
                  <!--Content Goes Here-->
                </section>
                
                <!--FAQ-->
                <section class="page-block faq" id="faq">
                  <!--Content Goes Here-->
                </section>
                
                <!--Testimonials-->
                <section class="page-block color" id="testimonials"><!--Color class means color background-->
                  <!--Content Goes Here-->
                </section>
                
                <!--Mobile Apps-->
                <section class="page-block mobile-apps" id="apps">
                  <!--Content Goes Here-->
                </section>
                
                <!--Team-->
                <section class="page-block team" id="team">
                  <!--Content Goes Here-->
                </section>
                
                <!--Contacts-->
                <section class="page-block contacts" id="contacts">
                  <!--Content Goes Here-->
                </section>
                
                <!--Social Networks-->
                <section class="page-block" id="social">
                  <!--Content Goes Here-->
                </section>
                
                <!--Footer-->
                <footer class="footer">
                  <!--Footer Content and Subscription Form Goes Here-->
                </footer>

Editing Side Navigation

To edit Side Navigation you need to find code block called "Navigation" in the file index.html(line#38).

Note 2 important classes "tooltipped" and "scroll" / scroll-up. The first class activates tooltipes with the text from "title" attribute. "scroll-up" class applied only to home link because it scrolls page to the top; "scroll" class applied to any link that scrolls page to the content block with the "id" achor point to.


                <!--Navigation-->
                  <nav class="side-navi animated">
                     <ul>
                        <li class="current"><a class="tooltipped scroll-up" href="#" data-toggle="tooltip" data-placement="left" title="Home"></a></li>
                        <li><a class="tooltipped scroll" href="#features" data-toggle="tooltip" data-placement="left" title="Features"></a></li>
                        .............................................                        
                     </ul>
                  </navn>

Replacing Images and Slides (Hero Slider)

To change images in the Hero Slider you need to go to Ultima / img / hero-slider

To add/remove/edit content of the slides you need to edit HTML code below. Each slide represented by <div class="slide"> tag.


                <!--Hero Slider-->
                  <div class="hero-slider">
                     <div class="slide first-slide">
                     <!--Slide Content Goes here-->
                     </div>
                     <div class="slide">
                     <!--Slide Content Goes here-->
                     </div>
                     ...................................
                  </div>

Editing Content in Other Blocks

To change images, texts and other content in chosen content block you need to find section with appropriate "id" tag.

For example, to edit content of the "Features" block go to section with id="features". If you need simply replace the images but retain content structure as it is you can do that in folder: Ultima / img / features.

Changing Social Icons

In this template we used 2 Icon fonts: IcoMoon and FontAwsome. They are Font icons which means you can easily change them by replacing icon-iconName class. in case of IcoMoon (used by default) or fa-iconName class. if you used FontAwsome icons.

For the full list of possible icon classes please visit:
http://icomoon.io/ - IcoMoon icons
http://fontawesome.io/icons/ - FontAwsome icons

Changing Look and Feel (Editing CSS Files)

There are two main CSS files that affect this template: bootstrap.min.css; theme-styles.css.

bootstrap.min.css - is Bootstrap 3.0 .css file which enables responsiveness and othe features. Ultima template totally based on Bootstrap 3.0. To learn more about Bootstrap 3.0 please visit http://getbootstrap.com/

theme-styles.css - is the stylesheet with all styles relating to this template. So whatever you need to change, change it there.

Changing Color Scheme

In you want to change main color (shade of red by default) you can easily do this in 2 simple steps:

1. Find .css file with appropriate color in Ultima / css / colors folder. All files' names end with number that corresponds with hex number of the color. In total we prepared 8 predefined colors. If you want to use your own color just edit .css rules that you find in this files.

2. Add .css file with chosen color right after <link href="css/theme-styles.css" rel="stylesheet" media="screen"> in the head of html file. See the code below (line in bold):


              	<head>
                ............................
                  <!--Theme Styles-->
                  <link href="css/theme-styles.css" rel="stylesheet" media="screen">
                 <!--Color Scheme-->
                 <link href="css/colors/color-4dbc84.css" rel="stylesheet" media="screen">
                 <!--4dbc84 means the hex color number-->
                ...................................
              	</head>

Changing Typography

In the "Body" section of the theme-styles.css file (line #25) you can globally change font-family and font-color of the template.


                /*Body*/
                body {
                  font-family: 'Roboto', Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
                  background-color: #ffffff;
                  font-weight: normal;
                  color: #313447;
                  -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased;
                }

To change typography styles you need to go to "Typography" section of the theme-styles.css file. It's line #96. Here you can globally change font color, font size, headings, paragraphs, list styles, etc..


                /*Body*/
                h1 {
                  font-size: 3.4em;
                  font-weight: 100;
                  margin-bottom: 20px;
                }
                h2 {
                  font-size: 2.65em;
                  font-weight: 100;
                  margin-bottom: 20px;
                }
                .............................
                p {
                  font-size: 1em;
                  margin-bottom: 20px;
                  line-height: 1.7;
                }
                ul, ol,
                ul.list-unstyled {
                  padding-left: 25px;
                  font-size: 1em;
                  line-height: 1.8;
                  margin-bottom: 25px;
                }

Changing Other Styles

CSS files segmented and commented the same way as HTML files. So, for example, if you want to change Forms styles you need to go to the relevant section in the CSS file.

Setting Up Ajax Contact Form

The new version of Ultima features Ajax Contact Form that will send emails to specified by you email address. The only thing you have to do is to go to Ultima/mailer folder find file called config.ini, open it in text editor change email addres to your own and default subject (optionally). That's it!

Please note the form will not work in local environment you have to upload your site to server.

jQuery Plugins (Editing JS Files)

Plugins Used

While creating this template we used some Javascript (jQuery) plugins to extend its functionality:*

jQuery v1.10.2 - most popular feature-rich JavaScript library.

jQuery Easing v1.3 - add-on for jQuery to create nice easing effects.

Modernizr - JavaScript library that detects HTML5 and CSS3 features in the userâ€™s browser.

Respong.js - script enables responsive web designs in browsers that don't support CSS3 Media Queries - in particular, Internet Explorer 8 and under.

TouchSwipe - Plugin that enables touch/swipe functionality on mobile devices.

bxSlider - The Responsive jQuery Content Slider.

iCheck - Customized Checkboxes and Radio Buttons for jQuery.

The Final Countdown - A simple and html agnostic date countdown plugin for jQuery.

jQuery Validate - Clientside Form Validation Plugin.

Charts.js - Easy, object oriented client side graphs.

*To get more detailed information about how to use / customize these plugins please visit their official websites.

Please be informed that we DO NOT provide support to any third party plugin's. We can only answer simple usage questions or issues related to incompatibility with the template.

Customizing Charts

In order to customize Charts you need to go to respective .js file. For example if you choose Landing Page with side scroller you need to edit landing1.js. It this file find the section called "CHARTS". For more information and online documentation, please visit plugin official website www.chartjs.org/

Setting Time/Time Format for Countdown (Coming Soon Page)

If you want to set time Countdown clock in your coming soon page you need to go to main / Ultima / js / coming-soon.js to section called "Countdown" (line#21) and edit lines in bold.


                /*Countdown*/
              	$('.countdown').countdown('2014/05/02', function(event) {
                  $(this).html(event.strftime('%D:%H:%M:%S'));
                  /*Time Format String where: %D - days; %H - hours; %M - minutes; %S - seconds.*/
                });

Editing Other JS Files

Like with HTML and CSS files to customize the JavaScript functionality of the template you need to edit landing.js file for Landing page, coming-soon.js file for Coming Soon page, components-styles.js file for Components & Styles page.

These files holding all custom JavaScript code for the template. They are properly commented so you easily find nesessary code snippet to modify.

Photoshop Files

All Photoshop files related to this template you will find in the PSD folder.

There are 3 .psd files:

Landing Page.psd - Layered psd file of Landing page;

Components & Styles.psd - Layered psd file of Components & Styles page;

Coming Soon.psd - Layered psd file of Coming Soon page.

Update v2.0.psd - Layered psd file with new elements and added navigation.

*Please note these files are production versions and could vary from final template. But still you will find there all necessary graphics and mockups to customize your site.

Photoshop Layers

All layers are grouped and named according to content blocks of the template. So it will be easy to spot the piece of content you want to modify.

To learn more about how to use Photoshop to edit images and graphics we recommend Photoshop on Adobe TV
